Name: From X-rays to Quarks: Modern Physicists and Their Discoveries (Dover Classics of Science & Mathematics)

ReviewList.Text: Segre's style on physics is straight forward and non-intimidating.  But what make this book is his stories. Emilio met and worked with many of these men.  He describes their personalities attitudes and politics, and they come alive in his book.  This is history the way it ought to be taught. Squisito!  Bravo!  Bravisimo!
This is a wonderful book. I'm glad it's back in print again. Highly recommended, together with "From Falling Bodies to Radio Waves".
In addition to reading this excellent book I recommend reading "Thirty Years That Shook Physic" by George Gamow too.
Is one of the best histories of radioactivity I know. First hand, as Emilio Segré was one of the protagonists, and very well writen.

Great book for an informative and relatively short review of the development of XX century physics - just exactly what the title says. Has a handful of interesting pictures of the main characters of the saga and should appeal to the high schooler and the layman interested in physics.
